QuestionStatement: In an economy in which all prices, including wages, are completely flexible, an increase in labor productivity will result in which of the following changes in output and real wages?
When the average price level increases by 10 percent in a given year, which of the following must increase by 10 percent for real output to remain constant?
AnswerChoices: The international value of the currency

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will occur in a competitive market when the price of a good is less than the equilibrium price?
AnswerChoices: Price will decrease to eliminate the surplus and restore equilibrium
Price will decrease to eliminate the shortage and restore equilibrium
Price will increase to eliminate the surplus and restore equilibrium
Price will increase to eliminate the shortage and restore equilibrium
Price will remain constant, because supply will increase to eliminate the shortage

QuestionStatement: A short-run Phillips curve shows an inverse relationship between
Which of the following can be expected to cause an increase in gross domestic product in the short run?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the tax rate
An increase in the interest rate
Equal increases in both imports and exports
Equal increases in both taxes and government expenditures
Equal decreases in both investment and government expenditures

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will cause the United States dollar to depreciate relative to the euro?
AnswerChoices: An increase in household income in the United States
An increase in interest rates in the United States
An increase in household income in Europe
A decrease in interest rates in Europe
A decrease in price level in the United States

QuestionStatement: Stagflation is most likely to be caused by
AnswerChoices: A large increase in the money supply

QuestionStatement: Assume that the nominal interest rate is 10 percent.  If the expected inflation rate is 5 percent, the real interest rate is
Which of the following will lead to an increase in the United States gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: More individuals prepare their own personal income tax forms.
Some citizens begin working abroad as computer programmers
The government prohibits the sale of alcoholic beverages
Foreign companies build new assembly plants in the United States
A million United States households sell their used cars to their children

QuestionStatement: An advance in technology will cause the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve to shift the right
Aggregate demand curve to shift to the left
Short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left
Long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left
Long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right

QuestionStatement: Suppose that the Federal Reserve buys $400 billion worth of government securities from the public.  If the required reserve ratio is 20 percent, the maximum increase in the money supply is
Before specialization and trade, the domestic opportunity cost of producing 1 ton of grain in Alpha and Beta is which of the following?
The theory of comparative advantage implies that Alpha would find it advantageous to
AnswerChoices: Export both grain and steel and import nothing
Import both grain and steel and export nothing
Trade 1 ton of grain for 0.5 ton of steel

QuestionStatement: At what real exchange ratio, also referred to as the terms of trade, between grain (G) and steel (S) would both Alpha and Beta find it mutually advantageous to specialize and trade?
AnswerChoices: There is no real exchange ratio that would enable both countries to benefit, since Alpha has an absolute advantage in both goods.

QuestionStatement: According to the graph above, which of the following is true about the long-run equilibrium of the economy depicted?
AnswerChoices: The economy is in long-run equilibrium
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the left to restore long-run equilibrium
The long-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right to restore long-run equilibrium
Without fiscal policy stimulus, the economy will remain in a recession
As wages increase, the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the left to restore long-run equilibrium

QuestionStatement: An increase in personal income taxes will most likely cause aggregate demand and aggregate supply to change in which of the following ways in the short run?
Which type of unemployment would increase if workers lost their jobs because of a recession?
Which of the following is true about the marginal propensity to consume?
AnswerChoices: It is the percentage of total income that is spent on consumption
It determines the size of the simple spending multiplier
It increases as incomes increase because increases in income cause people to spend more
It is the same as the money multiplier
It is equal to the average propensity to consume for people with low incomes

QuestionStatement: When an economy is operating below the full-employment level of output, an appropriate monetary policy would be to increase which of the following?
AnswerChoices: The international value of the dollar
Open market purchases of government bonds
Government expenditure on goods and services

QuestionStatement: Assume that the economy is at full employment.  Policymakers wish to maintain the price level but want to encourage greater investment.  Which of the following combinations of monetary and fiscal policies would best achieve this goal?
